clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of Vx006 Vaccine in Solid Tumor Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label, Uncontrolled Phase I Trial to Compare Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Vx-006 Vaccine at 0.5mg, 1mg, 5mg and 10mg Doses in Human Leukocyte Antigen-A02 (HLA-A02) Positive Patients With Solid Tumours

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with histologically proven malignancy with documented disease control (objective response or stable disease) or Not Evaluable Disease (NED) expectancy > 6 months; only HLA-A*02 positive patients.
The primary objective of the trial is to compare safety and tolerability of four different doses of Vx-006. The secondary objective is to compare immunogenicity of four different doses of the Vx-006.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse event number by treatment group as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.description: The following parameters of safety and tolerability will be assessed: Physical examination and vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate, body temperature, weight, height (only at baseline), Electrocardiogram, Adverse event evaluation, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status, Clinical laboratory evaluation: haematology and clinical chemistry Collection of concomitant medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Immune response evaluation by treatment group as a measure of efficacy

arm_group.description: Six injections of Vx-006 at 0,5 mg + Montanide ISA51™ will be administrated every 3 weeks
Six injections of Vx-006 at 1 mg + Montanide ISA51™ will be administrated every 3 weeks
Six injections of Vx-006 at 5 mg + Montanide ISA51™ will be administrated every 3 weeks
Six injections of Vx-006 at 10 mg + Montanide ISA51™ will be administrated every 3 weeks
